vulnerabilities.description: libcurl would reuse a previously created connection even when a TLS or SSHrelated option had been changed that should have prohibited reuse.libcurl keeps previously used connections in a connection pool for subsequenttransfers to reuse if one of them matches the setup. However, several TLS andSSH settings were left out from the configuration match checks, making themmatch too easily.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/1645e9b44505abd5cbaf65da5282c3f33b5924a5,https://github.com/curl/commit/f18af4f874cecab82a9797e8c7541e0990c7a64c) or upgrade to version>7.83.0

vulnerabilities.description: libcurl provides the `CURLOPT_CERTINFO` option to allow applications torequest details to be returned about a server's certificate chain.Due to an erroneous function, a malicious server could make libcurl built withNSS get stuck in a never-ending busy-loop when trying to retrieve thatinformation.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/5c7da89d404bf59c8dd82a001119a16d18365917) or upgrade to version>7.83.0

vulnerabilities.description: A insufficiently protected credentials vulnerability in fixed in curl 7.83.0 might leak authentication or cookie header data on HTTP redirects to the same host but another port number.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/6e659993952aa5f90f48864be84a1bbb047fc258) or upgrade to version>7.82.0

vulnerabilities.description: An insufficiently protected credentials vulnerability exists in curl 4.9 to and include curl 7.82.0 are affected that could allow an attacker to extract credentials when follows HTTP(S) redirects is used with authentication could leak credentials to other services that exist on different protocols or port numbers.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/620ea21410030a9977396b4661806bc187231b79) or upgrade to version>7.82.0

vulnerabilities.description: An improper authentication vulnerability exists in curl 7.33.0 to and including 7.82.0 which might allow reuse OAUTH2-authenticated connections without properly making sure that the connection was authenticated with the same credentials as set for this transfer. This affects SASL-enabled protocols: SMPTP(S), IMAP(S), POP3(S) and LDAP(S) (openldap only).
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/852aa5ad351ea53e5f01d2f44b5b4370c2bf5425) or upgrade to version>7.82.0

vulnerabilities.description: When doing a TFTP transfer and curl/libcurl is given a URL that contains a very long file name (longer than about 515 bytes), the file name is truncated to fit within the buffer boundaries, but the buffer size is still wrongly updated to use the untruncated length. This too large value is then used in the sendto() call, making curl attempt to send more data than what is actually put into the buffer. The endto() function will then read beyond the end of the heap based buffer. A malicious HTTP(S) server could redirect a vulnerable libcurl-using client to a crafted TFTP URL (if the client hasn't restricted which protocols it allows redirects to) and trick it to send private memory contents to a remote server over UDP. Limit curl's redirect protocols with --proto-redir and libcurl's with CURLOPT_REDIR_PROTOCOLS.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://curl.se/CVE-2017-1000100.patch,https://github.com/curl/commit/358b2b131ad6c095696f20dcfa62b8305263f898) or upgrade to version>7.54.1

vulnerabilities.description: When curl is used to retrieve and parse cookies from a HTTP(S) server, itaccepts cookies using control codes that when later are sent back to a HTTPserver might make the server return 400 responses. Effectively allowing a"sister site" to deny service to all siblings.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/8dfc93e573ca740544a2d79ebb0ed786592c65c3) or upgrade to version>7.84.0

vulnerabilities.description: When curl < 7.84.0 does FTP transfers secured by krb5, it handles message verification failures wrongly. This flaw makes it possible for a Man-In-The-Middle attack to go unnoticed and even allows it to inject data to the client.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/6ecdf5136b52af747e7bda08db9a748256b1cd09) or upgrade to version>7.83.1

vulnerabilities.description: When curl >= 7.20.0 and <= 7.78.0 connects to an IMAP or POP3 server to retrieve data using STARTTLS to upgrade to TLS security, the server can respond and send back multiple responses at once that curl caches. curl would then upgrade to TLS but not flush the in-queue of cached responses but instead continue using and trustingthe responses it got *before* the TLS handshake as if they were authenticated.Using this flaw, it allows a Man-In-The-Middle attacker to first inject the fake responses, then pass-through the TLS traffic from the legitimate server and trick curl into sending data back to the user thinking the attacker's injected data comes from the TLS-protected server.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/8ef147c43646e91fdaad5d0e7b60351f842e5c68) or upgrade to version>7.78.0

vulnerabilities.description: A user can tell curl >= 7.20.0 and <= 7.78.0 to require a successful upgrade to TLS when speaking to an IMAP, POP3 or FTP server (`--ssl-reqd` on the command line or`CURLOPT_USE_SSL` set to `CURLUSESSL_CONTROL` or `CURLUSESSL_ALL` withlibcurl). This requirement could be bypassed if the server would return a properly crafted but perfectly legitimate response.This flaw would then make curl silently continue its operations **withoutTLS** contrary to the instructions and expectations, exposing possibly sensitive data in clear text over the network.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/364f174724ef115c63d5e5dc1d3342c8a43b1cca) or upgrade to version>7.78.0

vulnerabilities.description: libcurl-using applications can ask for a specific client certificate to be used in a transfer. This is done with the `CURLOPT_SSLCERT` option (`--cert` with the command line tool).When libcurl is built to use the macOS native TLS library Secure Transport, an application can ask for the client certificate by name or with a file name - using the same option. If the name exists as a file, it will be used instead of by name.If the appliction runs with a current working directory that is writable by other users (like `/tmp`), a malicious user can create a file name with the same name as the app wants to use by name, and thereby trick the application to use the file based cert instead of the one referred to by name making libcurl send the wrong client certificate in the TLS connection handshake.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/fd9b40bf8dfd43edcbc0d254d613d95a11061c05) or upgrade to version>7.77.0

vulnerabilities.description: curl supports the `-t` command line option, known as `CURLOPT_TELNETOPTIONS`in libcurl. This rarely used option is used to send variable=content pairs toTELNET servers.Due to flaw in the option parser for sending `NEW_ENV` variables, libcurlcould be made to pass on uninitialized data from a stack based buffer to theserver. Therefore potentially revealing sensitive internal information to theserver using a clear-text network protocol.This could happen because curl did not call and use sscanf() correctly whenparsing the string provided by the application.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/894f6ec730597eb243618d33cc84d71add8d6a8a,https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/39ce47f219b09c380b81f89fe54ac586c8db6bde) or upgrade to version>7.77.0

vulnerabilities.description: libcurl keeps previously used connections in a connection pool for subsequenttransfers to reuse, if one of them matches the setup.Due to errors in the logic, the config matching function did not take 'issuercert' into account and it compared the involved paths *case insensitively*,which could lead to libcurl reusing wrong connections.File paths are, or can be, case sensitive on many systems but not all, and caneven vary depending on used file systems.The comparison also didn't include the 'issuer cert' which a transfer can setto qualify how to verify the server certificate.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/5ea3145850ebff1dc2b13d17440300a01ca38161) or upgrade to version>7.77.0

vulnerabilities.description: When curl is instructed to get content using the metalink feature, and a user name and password are used to download the metalink XML file, those same credentials are then subsequently passed on to each of the servers from which curl will download or try to download the contents from. Often contrary to the user's expectations and intentions and without telling the user it happened.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: upgrade to version>7.77.0

vulnerabilities.description: When curl is instructed to download content using the metalink feature, thecontents is verified against a hash provided in the metalink XML file.The metalink XML file points out to the client how to get the same contentfrom a set of different URLs, potentially hosted by different servers and theclient can then download the file from one or several of them. In a serial orparallel manner.If one of the servers hosting the contents has been breached and the contentsof the specific file on that server is replaced with a modified payload, curlshould detect this when the hash of the file mismatches after a completeddownload. It should remove the contents and instead try getting the contentsfrom another URL. This is not done, and instead such a hash mismatch is onlymentioned in text and the potentially malicious content is kept in the file ondisk.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: upgrade to version>7.77.0

vulnerabilities.description: curl 7.7 through 7.76.1 suffers from an information disclosure when the `-t` command line option, known as `CURLOPT_TELNETOPTIONS` in libcurl, is used to send variable=content pairs to TELNET servers. Due to a flaw in the option parser for sending NEW_ENV variables, libcurl could be made to pass on uninitialized data from a stack based buffer to the server, resulting in potentially revealing sensitive internal information to the server using a clear-text network protocol.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/39ce47f219b09c380b81f89fe54ac586c8db6bde,https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/39ce47f219b09c380b81f89fe54ac586c8db6bde) or upgrade to version>7.76.1

vulnerabilities.description: curl 7.1.1 to and including 7.75.0 is vulnerable to an "Exposure of Private Personal Information to an Unauthorized Actor" by leaking credentials in the HTTP Referer: header. libcurl does not strip off user credentials from the URL when automatically populating the Referer: HTTP request header field in outgoing HTTP requests, and therefore risks leaking sensitive data to the server that is the target of the second HTTP request.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/7214288898f5625a6cc196e22a74232eada7861c,https://github.com/curl/commit/7214288898f5625a6cc196e22a74232eada7861c) or upgrade to version>7.75.0

vulnerabilities.description: curl 7.21.0 to and including 7.73.0 is vulnerable to uncontrolled recursion due to a stack overflow issue in FTP wildcard match parsing.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/69a358f2186e04cf44698b5100332cbf1ee7f01d) or upgrade to version>7.73.0

vulnerabilities.description: A malicious server can use the FTP PASV response to trick curl 7.73.0 and earlier into connecting back to a given IP address and port, and this way potentially make curl extract information about services that are otherwise private and not disclosed, for example doing port scanning and service banner extractions.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/ec9cc725d598ac,https://github.com/curl/commit/ec9cc725d598ac77de7b6df8afeec292b3c8ad46) or upgrade to version>7.73.0

vulnerabilities.description: Due to use of a dangling pointer, libcurl 7.29.0 through 7.71.1 can use the wrong connection when sending data.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/3c9e021f86872baae412a427e807fbfa2f3e8a22,https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/3c9e021f86872baae412a427e807fbfa2f3e8) or upgrade to version>7.71.1

vulnerabilities.description: curl 7.20.0 through 7.70.0 is vulnerable to improper restriction of names for files and other resources that can lead too overwriting a local file when the -J flag is used.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/8236aba58542c5f.patch,https://github.com/curl/commit/8236aba58542c5f89f1d41ca09d84579efb05e22) or upgrade to version>7.70.0

vulnerabilities.description: curl and libcurl before 7.50.1 do not prevent TLS session resumption when the client certificate has changed, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended restrictions by resuming a session.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/33cfcfd9f0378625d3bddbd2c8ac5aad4b646f26,https://github.com/curl/commit/247d890da88f9ee817079e246c59f3d7d12fde5f) or upgrade to version>7.50.0

vulnerabilities.description: Heap buffer overflow in the TFTP protocol handler in cURL 7.19.4 to 7.65.3.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/facb0e4662415b5f28163e853dc6742ac5fafb3d,https://github.com/curl/commit/facb0e4662415b5f28163e853dc6742ac5fafb3d) or upgrade to version>7.65.3

vulnerabilities.description: A heap buffer overflow in the TFTP receiving code allows for DoS or arbitrary code execution in libcurl versions 7.19.4 through 7.64.1.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-5436,https://github.com/curl/commit/2576003415625d7b5f0e390902f8097830b82275) or upgrade to version>7.64.1

vulnerabilities.description: libcurl versions from 7.34.0 to before 7.64.0 are vulnerable to a heap out-of-bounds read in the code handling the end-of-response for SMTP. If the buffer passed to `smtp_endofresp()` isn't NUL terminated and contains no character ending the parsed number, and `len` is set to 5, then the `strtol()` call reads beyond the allocated buffer. The read contents will not be returned to the caller.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/39df4073e5413fcdbb5a38da0c1ce6f1c0ceb484,https://github.com/curl/commit/39df4073e5413fcdbb5a38da0c1ce6f1c0ceb484) or upgrade to version>7.63.0

vulnerabilities.description: Curl versions 7.33.0 through 7.61.1 are vulnerable to a buffer overrun in the SASL authentication code that may lead to denial of service.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/f3a24d7916b9173c69a3e0ee790102993833d6c5) or upgrade to version>7.61.1

vulnerabilities.description: curl before version 7.61.1 is vulnerable to a buffer overrun in the NTLM authentication code. The internal function Curl_ntlm_core_mk_nt_hash multiplies the length of the password by two (SUM) to figure out how large temporary storage area to allocate from the heap. The length value is then subsequently used to iterate over the password and generate output into the allocated storage buffer. On systems with a 32 bit size_t, the math to calculate SUM triggers an integer overflow when the password length exceeds 2GB (2^31 bytes). This integer overflow usually causes a very small buffer to actually get allocated instead of the intended very huge one, making the use of that buffer end up in a heap buffer overflow. (This bug is almost identical to CVE-2017-8816.)
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/57d299a499155d4b327e341c6024e293b0418243,https://github.com/curl/commit/57d299a499155d4b327e341c6024e293b0418243) or upgrade to version>7.61.0

vulnerabilities.description: curl version curl 7.20.0 to and including curl 7.59.0 contains a CWE-126: Buffer Over-read vulnerability in denial of service that can result in curl can be tricked into reading data beyond the end of a heap based buffer used to store downloaded RTSP content.. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in curl < 7.20.0 and curl >= 7.60.0.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1000301,https://github.com/curl/commit/8c7b3737d29ed5c0575bf592063de8a51450812d) or upgrade to version>7.59.0

vulnerabilities.description: A buffer over-read exists in curl 7.20.0 to and including curl 7.58.0 in the RTSP+RTP handling code that allows an attacker to cause a denial of service or information leakage
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1000122,https://github.com/curl/commit/d52dc4760f6d9ca1937eefa2093058a952465128) or upgrade to version>7.58.0

vulnerabilities.description: A buffer overflow exists in curl 7.12.3 to and including curl 7.58.0 in the FTP URL handling that allows an attacker to cause a denial of service or worse.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1000120,https://github.com/curl/commit/535432c0adb62fe167ec09621500470b6fa4eb0f) or upgrade to version>7.58.0

vulnerabilities.description: libcurl 7.1 through 7.57.0 might accidentally leak authentication data to third parties. When asked to send custom headers in its HTTP requests, libcurl will send that set of headers first to the host in the initial URL but also, if asked to follow redirects and a 30X HTTP response code is returned, to the host mentioned in URL in the `Location:` response header value. Sending the same set of headers to subsequent hosts is in particular a problem for applications that pass on custom `Authorization:` headers, as this header often contains privacy sensitive information or data that could allow others to impersonate the libcurl-using client's request.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1000007) or upgrade to version>7.57.0

vulnerabilities.description: The NTLM authentication feature in curl and libcurl before 7.57.0 on 32-bit platforms allows attackers to cause a denial of service (integer overflow and resultant buffer overflow, and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via vectors involving long user and password fields.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://curl.se/CVE-2017-8816.patch,https://github.com/curl/commit/7f2a1df6f5fc598750b2c6f34465c8d924db28cc) or upgrade to version>7.56.1

vulnerabilities.description: An IMAP FETCH response line indicates the size of the returned data, in number of bytes. When that response says the data is zero bytes, libcurl would pass on that (non-existing) data with a pointer and the size (zero) to the deliver-data function. libcurl's deliver-data function treats zero as a magic number and invokes strlen() on the data to figure out the length. The strlen() is called on a heap based buffer that might not be zero terminated so libcurl might read beyond the end of it into whatever memory lies after (or just crash) and then deliver that to the application as if it was actually downloaded.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://curl.se/CVE-2017-1000257.patch,https://github.com/curl/commit/13c9a9ded3ae744a1e11cbc14e9146d9fa427040) or upgrade to version>7.56.0

vulnerabilities.description: libcurl may read outside of a heap allocated buffer when doing FTP. When libcurl connects to an FTP server and successfully logs in (anonymous or not), it asks the server for the current directory with the `PWD` command. The server then responds with a 257 response containing the path, inside double quotes. The returned path name is then kept by libcurl for subsequent uses. Due to a flaw in the string parser for this directory name, a directory name passed like this but without a closing double quote would lead to libcurl not adding a trailing NUL byte to the buffer holding the name. When libcurl would then later access the string, it could read beyond the allocated heap buffer and crash or wrongly access data beyond the buffer, thinking it was part of the path. A malicious server could abuse this fact and effectively prevent libcurl-based clients to work with it - the PWD command is always issued on new FTP connections and the mistake has a high chance of causing a segfault. The simple fact that this has issue remained undiscovered for this long could suggest that malformed PWD responses are rare in benign servers. We are not aware of any exploit of this flaw. This bug was introduced in commit [415d2e7cb7](https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/415d2e7cb7), March 2005. In libcurl version 7.56.0, the parser always zero terminates the string but also rejects it if not terminated properly with a final double quote.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/5ff2c5ff25750aba1a8f64fbcad8e5b891512584) or upgrade to version>7.55.1

vulnerabilities.description: curl before version 7.52.0 is vulnerable to a buffer overflow when doing a large floating point output in libcurl's implementation of the printf() functions. If there are any application that accepts a format string from the outside without necessary input filtering, it could allow remote attacks.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/8829703b5a8d595457f3f4954cf09e6d6bae1523) or upgrade to version>7.51.0

vulnerabilities.description: The verify_certificate function in lib/vtls/schannel.c in libcurl 7.30.0 through 7.51.0, when built for Windows CE using the schannel TLS backend, makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks via a crafted wildcard SAN in a server certificate, as demonstrated by "*.com."
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://curl.haxx.se/CVE-2016-9952.patch) or upgrade to version>7.51.0

vulnerabilities.description: The verify_certificate function in lib/vtls/schannel.c in libcurl 7.30.0 through 7.51.0, when built for Windows CE using the schannel TLS backend, allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information, cause a denial of service (crash), or possibly have unspecified other impact via a wildcard certificate name, which triggers an out-of-bounds read.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://curl.haxx.se/CVE-2016-9952.patch) or upgrade to version>7.51.0

vulnerabilities.description: A flaw was found in curl before version 7.51. If cookie state is written into a cookie jar file that is later read back and used for subsequent requests, a malicious HTTP server can inject new cookies for arbitrary domains into said cookie jar.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/cff89bc088b7884098ea0c5378bbda3d49c437bc) or upgrade to version>7.50.3

vulnerabilities.description: A flaw was found in curl before version 7.51.0 When re-using a connection, curl was doing case insensitive comparisons of user name and password with the existing connections. This means that if an unused connection with proper credentials exists for a protocol that has connection-scoped credentials, an attacker can cause that connection to be reused if s/he knows the case-insensitive version of the correct password.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/b3ee26c5df75d97f6895e6ec4538894ebaf76e48) or upgrade to version>7.50.3

vulnerabilities.description: The libcurl API function called `curl_maprintf()` before version 7.51.0 can be tricked into doing a double-free due to an unsafe `size_t` multiplication, on systems using 32 bit `size_t` variables.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/8732ec40db652c53fa58cd13e2acb8eab6e40874) or upgrade to version>7.50.3

vulnerabilities.description: The `curl_getdate` function in curl before version 7.51.0 is vulnerable to an out of bounds read if it receives an input with one digit short.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/96a80b5a262fb6dd2ddcea7987296f3b9a405618) or upgrade to version>7.50.3

vulnerabilities.description: The URL percent-encoding decode function in libcurl before 7.51.0 is called `curl_easy_unescape`. Internally, even if this function would be made to allocate a unscape destination buffer larger than 2GB, it would return that new length in a signed 32 bit integer variable, thus the length would get either just truncated or both truncated and turned negative. That could then lead to libcurl writing outside of its heap based buffer.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/53e71e47d6b81650d26ec33a58d0dca24c7ffb2c) or upgrade to version>7.50.3

vulnerabilities.description: A flaw was found in curl before version 7.51.0. The way curl handles cookies permits other threads to trigger a use-after-free leading to information disclosure.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/c5be3d7267c725dbd093ff3a883e07ee8cf2a1d5) or upgrade to version>7.50.3

vulnerabilities.description: curl before version 7.51.0 doesn't parse the authority component of the URL correctly when the host name part ends with a '#' character, and could instead be tricked into connecting to a different host. This may have security implications if you for example use an URL parser that follows the RFC to check for allowed domains before using curl to request them.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/3bb273db7e40ebc284cff45f3ce3f0475c8339c2) or upgrade to version>7.50.3

vulnerabilities.description: curl before version 7.51.0 uses outdated IDNA 2003 standard to handle International Domain Names and this may lead users to potentially and unknowingly issue network transfer requests to the wrong host.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/9c91ec778104ae3b744b39444d544e82d5ee9ece) or upgrade to version>7.50.3

vulnerabilities.description: Multiple integer overflows in the (1) curl_escape, (2) curl_easy_escape, (3) curl_unescape, and (4) curl_easy_unescape functions in libcurl before 7.50.3 allow attackers to have unspecified impact via a string of length 0xffffffff, which triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/826a9ced2bed217155e34065ef4048931f327b1e,https://github.com/curl/commit/01cf1308ee2e792c77bb1d2c9218c56a30fd40ae) or upgrade to version>7.50.2

vulnerabilities.description: curl and libcurl before 7.50.1 do not check the client certificate when choosing the TLS connection to reuse, which might allow remote attackers to hijack the authentication of the connection by leveraging a previously created connection with a different client certificate.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/11ec5ad4352bba384404c56e77c7fab9382fd22d) or upgrade to version>7.50.0

vulnerabilities.description: Use-after-free vulnerability in libcurl before 7.50.1 allows attackers to control which connection is used or possibly have unspecified other impact via unknown vectors.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/75dc096e01ef1e21b6c57690d99371dedb2c0b80) or upgrade to version>7.50.0

vulnerabilities.description: Multiple untrusted search path vulnerabilities in cURL and libcurl before 7.49.1, when built with SSPI or telnet is enabled, allow local users to execute arbitrary code and conduct DLL hijacking attacks via a Trojan horse (1) security.dll, (2) secur32.dll, or (3) ws2_32.dll in the application or current working directory.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/6df916d751e72fc9a1febc07bb59c4ddd886c043) or upgrade to version>7.49.0

vulnerabilities.description: The ConnectionExists function in lib/url.c in libcurl before 7.47.0 does not properly re-use NTLM-authenticated proxy connections, which might allow remote attackers to authenticate as other users via a request, a similar issue to CVE-2014-0015.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/d41dcba4e9b69d6b761e3460cc6ae7e8fd8f621f) or upgrade to version>7.46.0

vulnerabilities.description: The default configuration for cURL and libcurl before 7.42.1 sends custom HTTP headers to both the proxy and destination server, which might allow remote proxy servers to obtain sensitive information by reading the header contents.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: upgrade to version>7.42.0

vulnerabilities.description: FRANK BROKE IT. The fix_hostname function in cURL and libcurl 7.37.0 through 7.41.0 does not properly calculate an index, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read or write and crash) or possibly have other unspecified impact via a zero-length host name, as demonstrated by "http://:80" and ":80."
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/0583e87ada7a3cfb10904ae4ab61b339582c5bd3) or upgrade to version>7.41.0

vulnerabilities.description: The sanitize_cookie_path function in cURL and libcurl 7.31.0 through 7.41.0 does not properly calculate an index, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write and crash) or possibly have other unspecified impact via a cookie path containing only a double-quote character.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/b5f947b8ac0e282c61c75b69cd5b9d37dafc6959) or upgrade to version>7.41.0

vulnerabilities.description: cURL and libcurl 7.10.6 through 7.41.0 do not properly re-use authenticated Negotiate connections, which allows remote attackers to connect as other users via a request.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/79b9d5f1a42578f807a6c94914bc65cbaa304b6d) or upgrade to version>7.41.0

vulnerabilities.description: cURL and libcurl 7.10.6 through 7.41.0 does not properly re-use NTLM connections, which allows remote attackers to connect as other users via an unauthenticated request, a similar issue to CVE-2014-0015.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/31be461c6b659312100c47be6ddd5f0f569290f6) or upgrade to version>7.41.0

vulnerabilities.description: CRLF injection vulnerability in libcurl 6.0 through 7.x before 7.40.0, when using an HTTP proxy, allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTTP headers and conduct HTTP response splitting attacks via CRLF sequences in a URL.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/bagder/curl/commit/178bd7db34f77e020fb8562890c5625ccbd67093,https://github.com/bagder/curl/commit/3df8e78860d3a3d3cf95252bd2b4ad5fd53360cd) or upgrade to version>7.39.0

vulnerabilities.description: The curl_easy_duphandle function in libcurl 7.17.1 through 7.38.0, when running with the CURLOPT_COPYPOSTFIELDS option, does not properly copy HTTP POST data for an easy handle, which triggers an out-of-bounds read that allows remote web servers to read sensitive memory information.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/b3875606925536f82fc61f3114ac42f29eaf6945) or upgrade to version>7.38.0

vulnerabilities.description: Curl versions 7.14.1 through 7.61.1 are vulnerable to a heap-based buffer over-read in the tool_msgs.c:voutf() function that may result in information exposure and denial of service.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/d530e92f59ae9bb2d47066c3c460b25d2ffeb211) or upgrade to version>7.61.1

vulnerabilities.description: curl supports "globbing" of URLs, in which a user can pass a numerical range to have the tool iterate over those numbers to do a sequence of transfers. In the globbing function that parses the numerical range, there was an omission that made curl read a byte beyond the end of the URL if given a carefully crafted, or just wrongly written, URL. The URL is stored in a heap based buffer, so it could then be made to wrongly read something else instead of crashing. An example of a URL that triggers the flaw would be `http://ur%20[0-60000000000000000000`.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://curl.se/CVE-2017-1000101.patch,https://github.com/curl/commit/453e7a7a03a2cec749abd3878a48e728c515cca7) or upgrade to version>7.54.1

vulnerabilities.description: The 'globbing' feature in curl before version 7.51.0 has a flaw that leads to integer overflow and out-of-bounds read via user controlled input.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/fbb5f1aa0326d485d5a7ac643b48481897ca667f) or upgrade to version>7.50.3

vulnerabilities.description: libcurl versions from 7.36.0 to before 7.64.0 is vulnerable to a heap buffer out-of-bounds read. The function handling incoming NTLM type-2 messages (`lib/vauth/ntlm.c:ntlm_decode_type2_target`) does not validate incoming data correctly and is subject to an integer overflow vulnerability. Using that overflow, a malicious or broken NTLM server could trick libcurl to accept a bad length + offset combination that would lead to a buffer read out-of-bounds.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/b780b30d1377adb10bbe774835f49e9b237fb9bb,https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/b780b30d1377adb10bbe774835f49e9b237fb9bb) or upgrade to version>7.63.0

vulnerabilities.description: libcurl versions from 7.36.0 to before 7.64.0 are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow. The function creating an outgoing NTLM type-3 header (`lib/vauth/ntlm.c:Curl_auth_create_ntlm_type3_message()`), generates the request HTTP header contents based on previously received data. The check that exists to prevent the local buffer from getting overflowed is implemented wrongly (using unsigned math) and as such it does not prevent the overflow from happening. This output data can grow larger than the local buffer if very large 'nt response' data is extracted from a previous NTLMv2 header provided by the malicious or broken HTTP server. Such a 'large value' needs to be around 1000 bytes or more. The actual payload data copied to the target buffer comes from the NTLMv2 type-2 response header.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/50c9484278c63b958655a717844f0721263939cc,https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/50c9484278c63b958655a717844f0721263939cc) or upgrade to version>7.63.0

vulnerabilities.description: A NULL pointer dereference exists in curl 7.21.0 to and including curl 7.58.0 in the LDAP code that allows an attacker to cause a denial of service
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1000121,https://github.com/curl/commit/9889db043393092e9d4b5a42720bba0b3d58deba) or upgrade to version>7.58.0

vulnerabilities.description: The FTP wildcard function in curl and libcurl before 7.57.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a string that ends with an '[' character.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://curl.se/CVE-2017-8817.patch,https://github.com/curl/commit/0b664ba968437715819bfe4c7ada5679d16ebbc3) or upgrade to version>7.56.1

vulnerabilities.description: The ourWriteOut function in tool_writeout.c in curl 7.53.1 might allow physically proximate attackers to obtain sensitive information from process memory in opportunistic circumstances by reading a workstation screen during use of a --write-out argument ending in a '%' character, which leads to a heap-based buffer over-read.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/1890d59905414ab84a35892b2e45833654aa5c13) or upgrade to version>7.53.1

vulnerabilities.description: The base64 encode function in curl before version 7.51.0 is prone to a buffer being under allocated in 32bit systems if it receives at least 1Gb as input via `CURLOPT_USERNAME`.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/efd24d57426bd77c9b5860e6b297904703750412) or upgrade to version>7.50.3

vulnerabilities.description: The function `read_data()` in security.c in curl before version 7.51.0 is vulnerable to memory double free.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/3d6460edeee21d7d790ec570d0887bed1f4366dd) or upgrade to version>7.50.3

vulnerabilities.description: curl and libcurl before 7.50.2, when built with NSS and the libnsspem.so library is available at runtime, allow remote attackers to hijack the authentication of a TLS connection by leveraging reuse of a previously loaded client certificate from file for a connection for which no certificate has been set, a different vulnerability than CVE-2016-5420.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/curl-7_50_2~32) or upgrade to version>7.50.1

vulnerabilities.description: The (1) mbed_connect_step1 function in lib/vtls/mbedtls.c and (2) polarssl_connect_step1 function in lib/vtls/polarssl.c in cURL and libcurl before 7.49.0, when using SSLv3 or making a TLS connection to a URL that uses a numerical IP address, allow remote attackers to spoof servers via an arbitrary valid certificate.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/6efd2fa529a189bf41736a610f6184cd8ad94b4d) or upgrade to version>7.48.0

vulnerabilities.description: cURL before 7.47.0 on Windows allows attackers to write to arbitrary files in the current working directory on a different drive via a colon in a remote file name.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Apply following patches : (https://github.com/curl/commit/3017d8a8d8849ebd4feae4f5eae037cd55736a61) or upgrade to version>7.46.0

vulnerabilities.description: The darwinssl_connect_step1 function in lib/vtls/curl_darwinssl.c in libcurl 7.31.0 through 7.39.0, when using the DarwinSSL (aka SecureTransport) back-end for TLS, does not check if a cached TLS session validated the certificate when reusing the session, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof servers via a crafted certificate.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: upgrade to version>7.39.0
